intro: Racosperma beckleri, commonly known as the slender acacia, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are typical of the acacia genus. Racosperma beckleri is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and inland environments.
